question: whether we can eat the sadhaka meat given by ourself?
answer:
QUESTION

whether we can eat the sadhaka meat given by ourself?

ANSWER


Share:

 

In the name of Allāh, Most Gracious, Most Merciful


Assalāmu ῾alaykum wa Rahmatullāhi Wabarakātuh

 

At the outset, obligatory charity (e.g. a person takes a vow etc.) can only be given to the poor and needy, 1 as for optional charity (nafly sadaqah) can be given to a rich or poor person.2

Now when the charity is given to a rightful person and thereafter he invites you, then you may partake from that meat. it will be permissible for you to eat whether it was given as obligatory or optional sadaqah.[1]

 (Ap ke Masā’il or Unkā Hal, Vol.3, Pg.425, Maktabah Bayyinat)1

(Fatāwa Rahimiyyah, Vol.7, Pg.202, Dārul Isha῾at)2

 

 

And Allāh Ta῾āla Knows Best
Wassalāmu ῾alaykum

 

Ml. Abduz Zaman,
Student Dārul Iftā

 

Concurred by: Ml. Abdur Rahman Shareef, Student Dārul Iftā

 

Under the guidance of:



Mufti Ebrahim Desai Saheb
Dārul Iftā

 3 وَالْأَصْلُ فِيهِ مَا رُوِيَ { أَنَّ بَرِيرَةَ كَانَ يُتَصَدَّقُ عَلَيْهَا ، وَتُهْدِيهِ إلَى رَسُولِ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ ، وَيَقُولُ : هِيَ لَهَا صَدَقَةٌ ، وَلَنَا هَدِيَّةٌ } ، فَهَذَا دَلِيلٌ عَلَى أَنَّ اخْتِلَافَ أَسْبَابِ الْمِلْكِ يَنْزِلُ مَنْزِلَةَ اخْتِلَافِ الْأَعْيَانِ. (مبسوط)
